alert.note: Alert for Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 9:29AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN CHERRY AND NORTHWESTERN KEYA PAHA COUNTIES THROUGH 1015 AM CDT... At 928 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Littleburg to 6 miles west of Sicangu Village. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Valentine, Crookston, Sparks, and Smith Falls State Park. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 181 and 213. Highway 97 between mile markers 136 and 141. Highway 83 between mile markers 203 and 222. Highway 12 between mile markers 1 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
